intro: Dendromecon flexile, commonly known as the flexible tree mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, featuring a woody stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive purple or red center, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to arid environments. Dendromecon flexile is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats.
